JUSTICE B.KEMAL PASHA MONDAY, THE 5TH DAY OF JANUARY 2015/15TH POUSHA, 1936 Cri.MC.No. 7067 of 2014 C.C.NO.2030/2014 OF JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE COURT- I, ALAPPUZHA PETITIONER(S)/ACCUSED : 1. BY ADV. SRI.K.RAMANATHAN RESPONDENT(S)/STATE & COMPLAINANT (CW'): 1. STATE OF KERALA, REPRESENTED BY THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA- 682 031. 2. SANDHYA, AGED 33 YEARS, W/O.ARUN GOPI @ SABU, GOVINDALAYAM (GOVINDAVILASAM), MARUTHORVATTOMN.P.O., CHERTHALA, ALAPPUZHA DISTRICT- 688 547. R1 BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR SRI.JIBU.P. THOMAS R2 BY ADV. SMT.V.PSATHI THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 05-01-2015, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: Msd. ANNEXURE A2: THE TRUE COPY OF THE FINAL REPORT IN CRIME NO.382/2014 OF MARARIKKULAM POLICE STATION IN C.C.NO.2030/14 PENDING BEFORE THE JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE'S COURT-I, ALAPPUZHA. ANNEXURE A3: THE ORIGINAL AFFIDAVIT SWORN BY THE 2ND RESPONDENT (DEFACTO COMPLAINANT). RESPONDENT(S)" ANNEXURES : NIL HTRUE COPY// P.A.TO JUDGE. Msd. Beal B. KEMAL PASHA, J. 201SIRERISG veneeene CE MC. NO-7067 OF 2014 Dated this the 5" day of January, 2015 ORDER This is a petition filed under Section 482 of the Code of Criminal Procedure. 2. Petitioners are accused Nos.1 to 4 in Crime No.382/2014 of Mararikkulam Police Station registered for the offences punishable under Sections 498A and 406 read with Section 34 of the Indian Penal Code. 3. Petitioners have come up with this petition for getting Annexure-A2 final report in Crime No.382/2014 of Mararikkulam Police Station as against the petitioners and all further proceedings based on it in C.C.2030/2014 pending before the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court-l, Alappuzha, quashed. 4. The allegation against the petitioners is that they have tortured and harassed the de facto complainant, who is the wife of the 1* petitioner, and treated her with cruelty within the meaning of Section 498A IPC, by demanding more dowry after misappropriating her entire gold BRE 2015/KER/36 Crl.M.C.7067/2014 oe ornaments and money, 5. Heard learned counsel for the petitioners, the learned counsel for the defacto complainant, who is the 2" respondent herein, and learned Public Prosecutor. 6. According to the petitioners, all the matters in dispute between the petitioners and the defacto complainant have been amicably settled and presently, the defacto complainant has no complaints against the petitioners and, therefore, the proceedings against the petitioners may be quashed. 7. The defacto complainant, who is the 2" respondent herein, has filed an affidavit affirming that all the matiers in dispute between her and the petitioners have been amicably settled and, therefore, she has no complaints against the petitioners and, therefore, all further proceedings in the matter referred to above can be quashed. She has entered appearance through her counsel. The learned counsel for the defacto complainant Beal 2015/KER/36 Crl.M.C.7067/2014 uae also endorses the fact that the affidavit has been sworn in by the defacto complainant on her own volition. 8. When all the matrimonial disputes have been setiled between the parties and as the defacto complainant has no complaints against the petitioners, it is only just and expedient in the interest of justice to quash the proceedings referred to above. In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed and Annexure-A2 final report in Crime No.382/2014 of Mararikkulam Police Station as against the petitioners and all further proceedings based on it in C.C.2030/2014 pending before the Judicial First Class Magistrate's Court-l, Alappuzha are hereby quashed. Sd/- (B.KEMAL PASHA, JUDGE) aks/05/01
